snippet: A new exhibition features over 40 objects that provide an overview of Greco-Roman geographical thinking and representation, tracing the roots of modern mapmaking.
abstract: Exhibit Measuring and Mapping Space: Geographic Knowledge in Greco-Roman Antiquity, at the Institute for the Study of the Ancient World in New York City, highlights ancient civilizations' attempts to understand world's size and shape and their role in laying foundations for modern map-making.
lead_paragraph: A new exhibition features over 40 objects that provide an overview of Greco-Roman geographical thinking and representation, tracing the roots of modern mapmaking.
